AT&T is laying off thousands of workers and shutting down at least 250 stores Link: /att-layoffs-thousands-jobs-cut-covid-19-june-2020-6

  • AT&T is cutting 3,400 jobs and shutting down more than 250 stores, a union representing the company's workers said on Tuesday.
  • The job cuts are part of the economic effect of the coronavirus pandemic and the carrier's efforts to focus on growth areas, AT&T said.
  • The layoffs come during a period of change for AT&T as chief operating officer John Stankey prepares to take over as CEO in July.
